text: Johann Ludwig von Windsheim, O.S.A. (died 1480) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Auxiliary Bishop of Regensburg (1468–1480) and Titular Bishop of Hierapolis in Phrygia. (1468–1480) (in Latin)"Bishop Johann Ludwig von Windsheim, O.S.A." Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved July 27, 2016"Diocese of Regensburg" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Diocese of Regensburg" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Ulrich Aumayer was ordained a priest in the Order of Saint Augustine. On 3 Aug 1468, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Paul II as Auxiliary Bishop of Regensburg and Titular Bishop of Hierapolis in Phrygia. He served as Auxiliary Bishop of Regensburg until his death on 19 Nov 1480. == See also == *Catholic Church in Germany == References == Category:15th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Paul II Category:1480 deaths Category:Augustinian bishops
title: Johann Ludwig von Windsheim
